thread.title: Census Data and Emergency Preparedness: Flood-Affected Areas in South Carolina
thread.title_full: Census Data and Emergency Preparedness: Flood-Affected Areas in South Carolina - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Census Data and Emergency Preparedness: Flood-Affected Areas in South Carolina
text:
U.S. Census Bureau
WASHINGTON , OCT. 9, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- The Census Bureau produces timely local data critical to emergency planning, preparedness and recovery efforts. To that end, a wide variety of statistics profiling the flood-affected areas of South Carolina are now available. These include demographic and socio-economic profiles of the population, housing characteristics and a portrait of businesses. An 11-county area is profiled, including Berkeley , Charleston , Clarendon , Dorchester , Georgetown , Horry , Lexington , Orangeburg , Richland , Sumter and Williamsburg . Internet address: http://www.census.gov/topics/preparedness.html .
No news release associated with this product. Tip Sheet only.
Public Information Office
census.gov
301-763-3030 / pio@census.gov
